Maybe you would use Moya to write the request like this:

code: // do something with the response data or statusCode
// this means there was a network failure - either the request
// wasn't sent (connectivity), or no response was received (server
// timed out).  If the server responds with a 4xx or 5xx error, that
// will be sent as a ".success"-ful response.

Chain Request provider class. Chain Requests should be made through this class only.
The chained request provider is used to manage interdependent network requests, and it can actually eventually be used to manage multiple topologically sorted network requests.
